repnme.cdata!: Nigeria - OSO Condensate Field Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the OSO Condensate Field Development
            Project in Nigeria. The primary objective of the Project was
            to assist in the commercial development of the Oso
            Condensate Field with the purpose of producing up to 100,000
            barrels of condensate per day. Bank's performance was
            highly satisfactory. Borrower's performance was highly
            satisfactory. The key lessons learned were as follows: (i)
            the major obvious lesson to be drawn from the Oso project is
            that, despite its large and complex physical nature, the
            financing and covenant structure was relatively simple; and
            (ii) given Nigeria's current economic difficulties and
            scarcity of resources, there is a need to ensure in future
            major upstream petroleum developments that priority be given
            first to  International Finance Corporation (IFC) sponsored
            private sector financings with the Bank being utilized only
            in its potential last resort capacity, subject to restoring
            and maintaining a viable and stable macroeconomic framework.

repnme.cdata!: Nigeria - Oso Condensate Field Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Through the development of the Oso
            condensate field, the OSO Condensate Field Development
            Project aims to increase Nigerian hydrocarbon exports,
            thereby enhancing significantly, the country's foreign
            exchange earnings.  In addition, the project will contribute
            to the institutional strengthening of the Nigerian National
            Petroleum Corporation (NNPC) by assisting in establishing
            the first formal joint operating agreement for upstream oil
            operations in Nigeria, strengthening NNPC's ability to
            market condensate, and reviewing NNPC's rolling
            five-year corporate plans and commercialization program.
            The project consists of the commercial development of the
            Oso condensate field jointly owned in undivided interests by
            NNPC and Mobil Producing Nigeria (MPN).  The field is
            situated 12 miles off-shore southeastern Nigeria.
            Recoverable reserves from the reservoir to be developed
            under the project are estimated conservatively at 330
            million barrels over the 21-year life of the project, with a
            production profile of 100,000 barrels per day during the
            first three to four years, and declining gradually
            thereafter.  The facilities consists of eight off-shore
            platforms for wellheads, production facilities, gas
            compression and living quarters; 120 miles of sub-sea
            pipelines for condensate and gas; onshore condensate storage
            and metering systems; and an offshore tanker loading
            facility for condensate. The drilling program consists of 19
            wells which include gas reinjection and production wells.

docna.cdata!: Nigeria - Oso Condensate Field Development Project
